dehghani2014analyzing.title: Analyzing political rhetoric in conservative and liberal weblogs related to the construction of the “ground zero mosque”
dehghani2014analyzing.author: Dehghani, Morteza and Sagae, Kenji and Sachdeva, Sonya and Gratch, Jonathan
dehghani2014analyzing.paperMotivationText: There is evidence that differences in the very definitions of morality are at the root of many social–ideological differences within a country. the language used by liberals and conservatives in political discussions often conveys the value systems adhered to by these groups and reflects the ideological differences between them.
dehghani2014analyzing.paperContributionText: The authors use different statistical text-analysis techniques to examine whether such ideological differences in political views are reflected in the use of language in liberal and conservative blog posts about the Cordoba Muslim Community Center.
dehghani2014analyzing.paperResultsText: They demonstrated that there are significant differences between liberals and conservatives in the use of various linguistic features and the choice of words.
dehghani2014analyzing.semiMLText: LDA with topic-in-set knowledge (semi-supervised variant of LDA)
